com.gdxgame.core.utils

Enum ResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ResourceManager>
      • com.gdxgame.core.utils.ResourceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ResourceManager>

    public enum ResourceManager
extends Enum<ResourceManager>
    The ResourceManager singleton is the core singleton to load and dispose resources. It supports loading and disposing of the following objects: - libgdx TextureAtlas - libgdx Skin - AnimatedSprite - libgdx Sound - libgdx Music ResourceManager keeps track of already loaded resources to not load them multiple times. It also has a convenient method to dispose all current resources. This is useful when the game is closing. Each resource has its own "accesscounter" meaning that if you call a load method for the same resource twice you also need to dispose it twice. The accesscounter is increased whenever calling a load method and is decreased whenever calling a dispose method. If the counter is 0 then the resource is disposed completely. F.e. if one of your gamestates requires texture A and another one also requires texture A and both gamestates are loaded within GDXGame then disposing the resources of one gamestate does not make texture A invalid for the other gamestate since it is not disposed (accesscounter is one).

      • loadTextureAtlas

        public void loadTextureAtlas(String internalAtlasName)
        loads a specific texture atlas. The loaded atlas can then be retrieved with the getTextureAtlas() method. Increases the accesscounter of the texture atlas if already loaded.
        Parameters:
        internalAtlasName - internal file path of the texture atlas

      • getTextureAtlas

        public TextureAtlas getTextureAtlas(String internalAtlasName)
        returns a specific texture atlas that was already loaded with the loadTextureAtlas() method
        Parameters:
        internalAtlasName - internal file path of the texture atlas
        Returns:
        null if the texture atlas was not successfully loaded yet. Otherwise the texture atlas will be returned.

      • disposeTextureAtlasAndSprites

        public void disposeTextureAtlasAndSprites(String internalAtlasName)
        Reduces the accesscounter of the texture atlas. If the accesscounter is 0 then the texture atlas that was already loaded with the loadTextureAtlas() method gets disposed.
        Parameters:
        internalAtlasName - internal file path of the texture atlas

      • loadAnimatedSprite

        public void loadAnimatedSprite(TextureType texture)
        loads a specific animated sprite. The loaded sprite can then be retrieved with the getAnimatedSprite() method. Increases the accesscounter of the sprite if already loaded.
        Parameters:
        texture - type of texture to be used for the sprite

      • getAnimatedSprite

        public AnimatedSprite getAnimatedSprite(TextureType texture)
        returns a specific animated sprite that was already loaded with the loadAnimatedSprite() method
        Parameters:
        texture - type of texture of the sprite
        Returns:
        null if the sprite was not successfully loaded yet. Otherwise the sprite will be returned.

      • disposeAnimatedSprite

        public void disposeAnimatedSprite(TextureType texture)
        Reduces the accesscounter of the sprite. If the accesscounter is 0 then the sprite that was already loaded with the loadAnimatedSprite() method gets disposed.
        Parameters:
        texture - type of texture of the sprite

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        sound - type of sound

      • loadTMXMap

        public void loadTMXMap(String tmxMapPath)
        Loads a map created with Tiled. Checks for animations within each tile layer by going through tile properties. If a property is defined with key AnimationXXX then the animation XXX will be stored to use it for AnimatedTiledMapTile. The values for animation XXX must be numbers between 1 and maximum number of animations used. If a property is defined with key AnimationsPerSecond then the animation that is also defined within the same tile will use the given animations per second defined.
        Parameters:
        tmxMapPath - file path to the tmx map

      • getTMXMap

        public TiledMap getTMXMap(String tmxMapPath)
        returns tmxmap that was already loaded with the loadTMXMap(String) method.
        Parameters:
        tmxMapPath - file path to the tmx map
        Returns:
        null if map was not successfully loaded yet. Otherwise the loaded TiledMap is returned.

      • disposeTMXMap

        public void disposeTMXMap(String tmxMapPath)
        disposes tmxmap that was already loaded with the loadTMXMap(String) method.
        Parameters:
        tmxMapPath - file path to the tmx map

      • disposeAllResources

        public void disposeAllResources()
        disposes all resources (texture atlas, sprites, sounds, music, ...) that were loaded with the ResourceManager. There are no more resources available after a call to this method. This method is automatically called when the game is closing.
